H0.text: Both plant and animal cells have a cell wall to give them support.

H1.text: Both plant and animal cells have a large vacuole to store water.

H2.text: Both plant and animal cells use mitochondria to produce energy.

H3.text: Both plant and animal cells use chloroplasts to store energy.

A4.text: Mitochondria are present in most organisms, including the majority of animals and some coniferous plants.

A5.text: Mitochondria are referred to as the 'powerhouse of the cell' due to their role in producing energy through ATP synthesis.
